intro: Monnina lancifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf monnina, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pinkish to red flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Monnina lancifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
